page.title: 01 Winsford
page.content: Winsford has an indigenous population which has remained relatively stable. During the last thirty years people from the{overspill {of Manchester and Liverpool}have moved to the area. Physically,the town is divided into the districts of Wharton and Over by the River Weaver. Down the road from Wharton is Meadowbank. It is just a cluster of houses but very interesting because Winsford's{salt mine}is situated there. Winsford has a new industrial estate but there is still high unemployment. Many of the houses are council houses.
